definition: to reject/to exclude/to eliminate/to remove/to repel
a row/a line/to set in order/to arrange/to line up/to eliminate/to drain/to push open/platoon/raft/classifier for lines, rows etc
to blame/to reprove/to reprimand/to expel/to oust/to reconnoiter/(of territory) to expand/saline marsh

sentences.english: It is, essentially, a rejection of Hellenic intellectualism by the sentimentalism of the North.
sentences.chinese: 它在本质上是北方的重情主义对希腊尚知主义的排斥。

sentences.english: Minor Circle is the circle formed by the innermost surface of the spline.
sentences.chinese: 小圆是花键的最小齿形面的排斥圆。

sentences.english: I have been an outcast my entire life.
sentences.chinese: 我的一生都是在受人排斥的。

sentences.english: Objective To explore the mechanism of immuno- rejection for the swine allogenic chondrocytes in transplantation.
sentences.chinese: 目的探讨猪软骨细胞同种异体移植的免疫排斥机制。

sentences.english: Desensitized patients are at high risk of developing acute antibody-mediated rejection.
sentences.chinese: 致敏患者有发生急性抗体介导的排斥反应的高度危险。

sentences.english: You should consider settings and options to be mutually exclusive .
sentences.chinese: 你应该考虑设置和选项的相互排斥性。

sentences.english: Which country if have to repels this kind of progress, indicate that they are abnormal.
sentences.chinese: 如果有哪个国家排斥这种进步，就表明他们不正常。

sentences.english: Now, you might find this sort of project in the end to be repellant.
sentences.chinese: 现在，你可以发现这类目标最后是被排斥的。

sentences.english: She's rejected in class because of he clumsiness.
sentences.chinese: 她因为行动笨拙而被班上同学排斥。

sentences.english: You reject positive experiences by insisting they don’t count.
sentences.chinese: 你拒不接受积极的体验，坚持把他们排斥在外。

sentences.english: And at a distance of 2 r naught, I have a positive repulsive term.
sentences.chinese: 在这2r圈的距离上，这里有一个不可忽略的排斥场。

sentences.english: In proportion therefore, as the repulsiveness of the work increases, the wage decreases.
sentences.chinese: 因此，当劳动的排斥增加，工资就减少。

sentences.english: Certainly the phenomenon of sexuality-in-flux is by no means exclusive to women.
sentences.chinese: 当然性倾向在同量的情况下绝非排斥女性。

sentences.english: The void is always elusive, having no opposite, there is nothing which excludes or opposes.
sentences.chinese: 虚无包含一切，无所不容，不存在对立与排斥。

sentences.english: School remains a place where intellect is mistrusted.
sentences.chinese: 学校仍在排斥对智力的培养。

sentences.english: Ostracized by the community for immoral activities.
sentences.chinese: 因为道德败坏的行为被社会所排斥。

definition: to be disgusted with/to dislike/bad reaction/antipathy
to crowd out/to push aside/to supplant
hostile/malevolence/antagonism/to view as enemy/to stand against
to approve of/to endorse/to acknowledge/to recognize/to identify oneself with
to view sb as an enemy/to be hateful towards
to fight against/to oppose/to be opposed to/opposition
